intro: Epipactis macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf helleborine, is a perennial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and its showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces a single spike of flowers, which can bear up to 15 blooms. Epipactis macrophylla is a non-woody plant that thrives in temperate climates and is often found in association with other orchid species.
